utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Check it out! This is unbelievable! Joey has been holding his breath for almost four minutes!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude! What are yo—you trying to kill me?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, I wanna ask you something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well since I’m movin’ out and-and you’re so beautiful…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …how about I move in with you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, that would be great but then what do we do about Denise?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who’s Denise?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My roommate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You have a roommate?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, Denise. Denise!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what is with the secrecy Phoebe? Huh? And what about this Denise, is she cute?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pheebs, I don’t understand. How can you have a roommate that none of us know anything about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe because you never listen to anything that I say. I talk about her all the time! DENISE!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Rach, listen I was thinkin’ uh, I’m gonna have an extra room over at my place…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that’s true.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, why don’t you move in with me? It’ll be great! We could stay up late, watch movies, and you know about Naked Thursday’s right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah I think I’m gonna find my own place.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey-hey! I thought Naked Thursday’s was just our thing man!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, what did Rachel say when you told her you were still married to her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, that. Umm, she took it really well.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You didn’t tell her did you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Of course not, because you’re in love with her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am not in love with her. She was very upset about having to move out so I eh, didn’t tell her we were still married because she would only get more upset. I-I just comforted her, as a friend.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What do you mean, comforted her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s nothing, I just gave her a hug.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah-ha! A classic sign of love, the hug!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s also a sign of friendship.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, not in your case Lovey Loverson.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It was a hug!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, just tell me this, did you or did you not smell her hair?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: S-s-smell her hair? What if I did?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ninety percent of a women’s pheromones come out the top of her head! That’s why, that’s why women are shorter. So that men will fall in love when they hug them! Oh come on Ross, you’re a scientist.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I was hugging her as a friend. It’s not my fault her-her hair got in my face, she’s got a lot of it and it smells all-all uh…coconutty. What?! Oh, that doesn’t mean I have feelings for Rachel! Maybe it means I have feelings for coconuts!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, whatever you say. But just be careful, all right? Rachel’s not in the same place you are.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: If the place you are referring too is being in love, then she is in the same place as me because I am not in that place!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I didn’t understand that, but y’know, maybe that’s ‘cause you were speaking the secret language of love!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Dude, some guy just called for you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Who was it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know! How about, "Thanks for taking the message." Jeez!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay listen, y’know when you move in Rachel’s room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? With a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! And we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! Okay, whatever, I really haven’t thought about it that much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I like that idea. Obviously! I was thinking maybe-maybe-maybe it could be a game room, y’know? I mean you can buy old arcade games like uh, like Space Invaders and Asteroids for $200, the real ones! The big-big ones!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay so you mean no as in, "Gee Chandler, what an interesting idea. Let’s discuss it before we reject it completely."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. Of course I mean that. Interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, that’s it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just don’t think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. The beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Which is why Asteroids is perfect! It’s the oldest game!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What do you have against the beautiful guest room?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t have anything against the beautiful guest room, especially since everybody we know lives about 30 seconds away!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you mocking me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I’m not mocking you, or you beautiful guest room.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nothing, Monica and I had a stupid fight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But you’re still moving in together, right? Because my ad came out today.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." Nice!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah? I just figured y’know, after living with you it’d be an interesting change of pace to have a female roommate, y’know? Someone I can learn from, someone-someone who’s different than me. And what’s more different than me; a guy who’s not 19 than say a girl who is 19? Enh? Not just a hat rack my friend!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, I have to ask you…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Shhhhhh! I’m swamped right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re just staring into space.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, I’m trying to move that pencil.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This one?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It worked!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, this whole apartment thing is just a nightmare! Every place I can afford comes with a roommate who is a freak. I mean, look at this; "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." It’s just, there is nothing! The city’s full!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, no, look at this! "Two bedroom, two bath, must be non-smoker, Satan worshipers okay…" Oh, yeah, but it’s on the ground floor.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, uh, you still looking for a place?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, there’s this guy, Warren, from the museum and he’s going on a dig for like two years and he’s got this great place he needs to sublet. So uh, you interested?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That sounds great! I’d love to live at Warren’s!! I love Warren! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Don’t thank me! If you wanna thank something, thank the volcano that erupted thousands of years ago, killing but perfectly preserving an entire civilization. Here’s Warren’s number.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, this is great! I am gonna call him right now! Oh, thank you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, you go grab it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I saw it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, I’m talking about that which you already know but won’t admit. You love her again; you re-love her!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I do not re-love her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe you won’t just admit it! Okay, just promise me that you won’t do anything stupid.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, we’re just friends now! Okay? Why would I do anything stupid?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh!!! Well, the apartment is already subletted! I mean, this is just hopeless. I’m never gonna find anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You can live with me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Are you serious?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I would love to live with you Ross; that’s-that’s great! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’m-I’m just glad I could, y’know, help you out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! I’m-I’m so happy for you guys. This is so-so, not stupid.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross-Ross, you have no idea what this means to me! I mean, I mean I was gonna be homeless. You just saved me! You’re my hero!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hero, I uh, I don’t know—well, all right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I have to go tell Monica what a wonderful brother she has!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh please! You’re gonna say things now, aren’t ya?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. No, I won’t. But I should tell you this, this exact same thing happened to my roommate Denise. She moved in with a guy who was secretly married to her and he said he didn’t love her, but he really did, and it just blew up! And that’s how she ended up living with me! Okay, that’s a lie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, listen, I’m sorry about before. I don’t need to have a game room. I mean when I was a kid I only played those games because I couldn’t get girls, and now I can ‘em—Now, I have you. Not-not that I think that I have you or think of you as property in any sort of way, I see women…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Stop it Chandler. I’m sorry too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! Oh yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen, we don’t have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s a great idea! We can easily think of a way for us both to enjoy the room.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Totally!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We don’t have to come up with this now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what? Why don’t we think about changes we can make in the living room?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Changes?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean we’re gonna have to move around some furniture to make room for my chair.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re-you’re-you’re gonna bring the Barca Lounger over here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it’s a set and they should probably stay together.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, that’s cool. Then I’ll just bring them both over.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See now-now you’re taking them away from their home.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I get it. So, I get nothing! Nothing here is mine! Everything here is yours! I’ll get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, y’know what? Yeah, that’s it-that’s it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! That’s-that’s what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! I’m talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesn’t match! Where is it gonna go?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: In the game room!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right! That’s fine! That’s fine! I won’t bring over the chairs! I won’t bring anything over! I wouldn’t want to ruin the ambiance over here at Grandma’s place!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Everything on your application looks really good—Ohh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: Oh don’t worry, I’m not really a party girl.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa!! Now look, don’t be just blurtin’ stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You can call off the roommate search! Hi! I’ll be living here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh don’t listen to him, he’s just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I don’t think he’s gonna get it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why did you take the shower curtain down?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That thing was a hazard! I’m very safety conscious.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Oh listen, I was just clearing some space for your stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh thanks, but listen, I was just at Monica’s and she and Chandler had a big fight and they’re not moving in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you mean, they’re not moving in? They-they’re still moving in right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no, they just had a big blowout over what to do with my room.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! Over a stupid room!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I feel kinda bad for them, but I’m also really psyched ‘cause I don’t have to move in here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no, yeah no, that part’s great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, we can handle this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, apparently not, and I can’t just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, why don’t you tell her to stop being silly!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay-okay! Two very good points, look I’ve known you both a long time, and I’ve never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you’ve been since you’ve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Love is the best medicine.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s laughter.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why do you do it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, don’t ya?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: So I understand you’re looking for a place.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no, I’m staying put.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Oh, I was going to offer you my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. That’s great news right—I mean for them. Right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah but, on the bright side, we get to be roommates again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Y’know umm, uh, umm, about that, umm, Ross I really appreciate your offer to let me move in and everything, but don’t you think it’s gonna be weird?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wh-why?! Why-why-why would it, why would it be weird?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, because of us! Because of our history.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! It would be weird if we were still in that place, I mean are you still in that place?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Not at all!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good! Me neither! So it’s not a problem. We’re just two friends who happen to be roommates.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, but Ross, eventually you and I are gonna be dating.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?! We are?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! I’m gonna have a boyfriend, you’re gonna have a girlfriend…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh! That would be great.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But y’know what, if you think it’s gonna be okay we’ll just work out a system. Y’know, it’ll be like college, I’ll hang a hanger on the door and put a sign, "Come back later, I’m gettin’ lucky."

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I didn’t think of that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean it’s a really big step! And-and what’s the rush?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s very funny!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He’s being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I-I-I’m serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing y’know you break up!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isn’t about the room, this is about what the room…represents! And unfortunately, this room could destroy you!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm not so worried.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, no, me neither.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine! It’s your life! I just don’t want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, but that’s what you want, there’s nothing I can do. DON’T DO IT!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You still want to move in together right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Of course!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross didn’t scare you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come here, I want to show you something!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God! Someone’s killed Square Man!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and it’s still walking distance to the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s so sweet! I want to show you something too!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know those big-big uh, road signs that say "Merge?"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know? So I was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. Because, that’s you and I together! Merge!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! I love that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh, no!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I found you in my bed!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now if you want to receive e-mails about my upcoming shows, then please give me money so I can buy a computer.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So umm, where are the other guys?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, well let’s see Monica and Chandler are occupied.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fighting?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, the other thing. I really think it’s great they work things out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. There’s no breaking them up, is there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, can I borrow the key to your house so I can run across the street and make a copy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure! Here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. Now are you sure? Because once I make a copy, there’s no turning back.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m-I’m sure. Yeah, get out of here before I change my mind.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Umm, listen, Ross do you really think this moving in with Rachel is a good idea?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’ve been back and forth.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah well, maybe you should go back! Okay? Rachel moves in, and before you know it you’re right where you don’t want to be! Back together!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ehh, I don’t, I don’t think so. She’s already talked about y’know, dating other guys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not gonna work out! Then she’s gonna come home all weepy and you’ll be tellin’ her, "Oh that’s okay. You’ll find someone." And then, bamn! She finds you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, well, m-maybe you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I am telling you Ross, she is definitely gonna fall in love with you again! Now, is that what you want?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is that what I want?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here she comes. Hold on, I’m gonna make your life much easier.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, well the place was closed. I’ll just copy it later.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Or not. Uh, Rach, why don’t you just move in with me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa, Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no… It’s okay, I mean I—look Rach, I know I scared you off with that whole Naked Thursday’s thing, but we don’t have to do that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, it would be easier to move just right across the hall. Wait a minute, unless you’re thinking about Naked Wednesday’s.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thursday’s clearly not good for ya, pick a day!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come in. Thanks for comin’ back, umm, okay there have been a lot of people interested in the room, but I have narrowed it down and you are one of the finalists!

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay now, before I make my final decision I uh, I just want to make sure our personalities match. Okay, so I made up a little test. Now, I’m gonna say a word and then you say the first thing that comes to mind.

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! Here we go. Pillow.

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: Fight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Very good! Okay. G.

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: String?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Excellent! Okay umm, doggy.

utterance.speaker: The Potential Roommate
utterance.content: Kitten?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, sorry! No-no-no, so close though, but—bye-bye!
